page.title: 12The Observer. Kingswood.
page.content: The{Observer Newspaper}is a free paper which is delivered to every house in the Kingswood district. The paper was first issued in{1886}but there have only been free editions for the last 10 years. Its{circulation}is approximtely{15,000.}The production costs are met by local firms' advertising. The team of reporters live out of the area so that they can be objective in their reports of local events. The paper carries stories about{local events and issues.}Over the last year (1984), two of the major stories have been the new{Avon {Ring Road}which will pass through the area, and the opening of the{Cycle Track which now links Bristol with Bath.{Unemployment,}and the possibility of providing new{leisure {facilities,}have also been highlighted as important local issues.
